conclusion: A particle moves along two semi-circular arcs, each with a radius of 1m, from point A to point C, taking 5 seconds.
The first semicircle (A → B) lies above the straight baseline, the second (B → C) below it.
End-points A, B and B, C are diametrically opposite on each semicircle.

premise: End-points A, B and B, C are diametrically opposite on each semicircle. Radius of each semicircle: R = 1 m.

conclusion: The straight-line distance from A to C is AC = AB + BC = 2 m + 2 m = 4 m.

premise: A and C are on the same horizontal line.
conclusion: Their vertical coordinates are identical; displacement is therefore 4 m due east.

premise: Radius of each semicircle: R = 1 m.
conclusion: Length of one semicircle = πR = π(1 m) = π m.

premise: Length of one semicircle = π m.
conclusion: Two semicircles give a total path length s = 2π m ≈ 6.283 m.

premise: Total distance = 2π m and time = 5 s.
conclusion: Average speed v̄_speed = total distance / time = (2π m)/(5 s) ≈ 1.26 m s⁻¹.

premise: Displacement magnitude: |Δr| = 4 m. Direction: due east. Time = 5 s.
conclusion: Average velocity v̄ = Δr / Δt = (4 m)/(5 s) = 0.80 m s⁻¹ due east.
